snippet: Despite a growing controversy, the British government has yet to confirm or deny reports that it was given information on its citizens from an American surveillance program called Prism.
abstract: British government, stung by allegations that it colluded with American intelligence agencies to collect data on its citizens, insists that its secret services operate within law; has yet to confirm or deny reports that it was given information on its citizens from American surveillance program known as Prism.
lead_paragraph: Despite a growing controversy, the British government has yet to confirm or deny reports that it was given information on its citizens from an American surveillance program called Prism.

headline.main: Accused of Scheming With U.S., Britain Says It Follows the Law in Gathering Intelligence
headline.print_headline: Accused of Scheming With U.S., Britain Says It Follows the Law in Gathering Intelligence
